mission.headline: About Us
mission.title: Transformative Insights and Multi-faceted Evaluation
mission.subtitle: Building AI that is Transparent, Inclusive, Measured, and Ethical.
missionContent: TIME Lab is currently undergoing a significant transformation. Originally named Temporal Intelligence and Motion Extraction, we are now shifting from fundamental research toward aggregating applicable data and generating evolutionary insights.

We are expanding from action recognition and anomaly detection to broader video and scene understanding, and from analyzing human-perceivable motions to capturing subtle changes such as particle shifts, seasonal transitions, or plant growth.

TIME now represents our broader mission: Building AI that is Transparent (promotes openness, auditability, and trust), Inclusive (reflects fairness, diversity, and bias mitigation), Measured (emphasizes accountability and quantifiable performance), and Ethical (aligns with responsible AI principles).
Integrating collective experiences from ANU, Data61/CSIRO, Griffith, and UNSW, we are approaching our next and more mature phase—TIME³.

timeline.name: Lab Founded at ANU
timeline.description: TIME Lab was established at Australian National University, originally named Temporal Intelligence and Motion Extraction, focusing on fundamental research in action recognition and anomaly detection.

timeline.name: Collaboration with Data61/CSIRO
timeline.description: Strengthened partnership with CSIRO's Data61, expanding research scope and industry applications in video processing and dynamics analysis.

timeline.name: Integration with Griffith & UNSW
timeline.description: TIME Lab evolved by integrating expertise from Griffith University and UNSW, marking the transition to TIME³ and a more mature phase of development.

timeline.name: TIME 2025 Workshop at WWW'25
timeline.description: Announcing the TIME 2025 workshop at WWW'25 in Sydney, highlighting our new direction: Transformative Insights and Multi-faceted Evaluation, with focus on Transparent, Inclusive, Measured, and Ethical AI.
